title: Calendar heatmaps in R
text: Signed values supported directly standard continuous scales:
code: library(ggplot2) library(ggcalheat)  set.seed(1) df <- data.frame(   date = seq.Date(as.Date("2025-01-01"), as.Date("2025-03-31"), by = "day"),   value = rpois(90, lambda = 3) )  ggplot(df, aes(date = date, value = value)) +   geom_calendar() +   scale_fill_gradient(low = "grey95", high = "#2C7FB8") df_signed <- data.frame(   date = seq.Date(as.Date("2025-01-01"), as.Date("2025-02-28"), by = "day"),   value = rnorm(59, mean = 0, sd = 2) )  ggplot(df_signed, aes(date = date, value = value)) +   geom_calendar() +   scale_fill_gradient2(     low = "#B2182B",     mid = "white",     high = "#2166AC",     midpoint = 0   )

title: Calendar heatmap geometry — geom_calendar
text: geom_calendar() draws one tile per day computes calendar positions input data. Users need map date value; week/day placement handled internally.

title: Calendar heatmap geometry — geom_calendar
code: geom_calendar(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   ...,   week_start = "sunday",   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   na_value = 0,   cell_width = 0.95,   cell_height = 0.95,   color = NA,   linewidth = 0,   na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )

title: Calendar heatmap geometry — geom_calendar
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created ggplot2::aes(). Must include date value. data data frame. ... Additional parameters passed ggplot2::layer(). week_start First day week. One "sunday", "monday", 0, 1. start_date Optional lower date bound displayed range. end_date Optional upper date bound displayed range. na_value Value assigned dates missing input data. cell_width Width day tile. cell_height Height day tile. color Tile border color. linewidth Tile border line width. na.rm Passed ggplot2::geom_tile() control NA handling. show.legend layer included legends? inherit.aes FALSE, overrides global aesthetics.
